The data on this page were constructed as part of the paper "Building a composite Help-Wanted Index" (Barnichon, 2010). Anyone is free to download the data and use it in his/her own research, as long as he/she cites the aforementioned paper.	
Update (02/2017): 
Because of divergence in the online HWI series and the JOLTS (see Cajner and Radner 2016, "A Cautionary Note on the Help Wanted Online Data"), I now rely solely on the JOLTS V (number of non-farm ads) past 2001Q1. 
The composite HWI index over 1951Q1-200Q4 was converted in units of job openings rate, ie #V/(size of the Labor Force).	
	
See the paper for details and construction methods for the composite HWI over 1951-2000.
